## Motivation

> Certain aspects of spatiotemporal data cannot be effectively represented by line glyphs. `sugarglider` enables users to visualize variations in the data through the use of ribbon and segment plots.

```{r, fig.align='center', out.width="60%"}
include_graphics("figures/cubble_example.png")
```


## Overview 

::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}

```{r, eval=FALSE, echo=TRUE}
ggplot(data, 
    aes(x_major = long, 
        y_major = lat,
        x_minor = month, 
        ymin_minor = minimum,
        ymax_minor = maximum)) +
  # Base map
  geom_sf(abs_ste) +
  # Glyph boxes
  add_glyph_boxes() +
  # Reference lines
  add_ref_lines() +
  # Ribbon Glyphs
  geom_glyph_ribbon() +
  # Legend
  add_glyph_legend()
```
